body: LEAD: An 18-year-old high school student was stabbed to death yesterday in a fight with another youth on a northbound F train in Carroll Gardens following a dispute the pair had a few days ago, the transit police said. title: Metro Datelines; Youth, 18, Is Killed In Subway Stabbing

body: LEAD: ''IT'S not easy to find good erasers anymore,'' said Sammy Globus, who ought to know. The 10-year-old connoisseur was sitting on his bedroom floor in New York surrounded by the Sammy Globus Collection of Pencil Erasers, an assemblage that may one day do for bits of rubber what Andy Warhol did for cookie jars. title: When Child's Play Is Collecting, It's Serious Stuff

body: LEAD: A century-old wooden bridge in Brooklyn, closed for repairs since 1985, was reopened yesterday with flags and brass bands in a ceremony that officially reunited two neighborhoods on opposite sides of the Gowanus Canal. title: 2 Neighborhoods Celebrate Restoration of Their Bridge

body: LEAD: While opponents speak in hopeful generalities, an incumbent mayor campaigning for re-election can - and Edward I. Koch does - hold forth the prospect of specific new housing and workplaces, pinpointing their locations and describing them appreciatively, almost as if they had already been built. title: Revisiting Promises Koch Made in '85

body: LEAD: A volatile mixture of deep-seated racial animosities, starkly segregated environments and fear of economic change may have fostered the murder of a 16-year-old black youth in Bensonhurst last month, say social scientists who have studied race relations in large cities like New York. title: Hatred and Social Isolation May Spur Acts of Racial Violence, Experts Say

body: LEAD: Every afternoon at 3 o'clock, a private patrol car begins rolling through one of the prettiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn. It cruises under canopies of ailanthus and maple trees, past unbroken rows of 19th-century brownstones, chocolate-rich and crisply preserved, with their jaunty window bays and welcoming stoops. Every afternoon at 3
title: In Enclave, Mayor's Race Hinges on Crime

body: LEAD: THE Department of Transportation is racing to meet a deadline for reopening the little Carroll Street Bridge across the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn. The unusual 1889 retractile-type bridge - the oldest in the country - has been left open since 1986, but the department has been repairing it since last December and it should be working in time
title: STREETSCAPES: The Carroll Street Bridge; Getting a Landmark in Shape for Its 100th Birthday

body: LEAD: Msgr. Francis Del Vecchio, who was pastor of the Roman Catholic Church of the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary and St. Stephen in Brooklyn for 36 years, died of cancer Thursday at the rectory there. title: Francis Del Vecchio, Ex-Pastor, Dies at 78

body: LEAD: IN 1973, Rose Scarcella of the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn, learned that her son had Hodgkin's disease. His doctors predicted that he would live only five more years. body: LEAD: Brooklyn is getting its second condominium parking garage, this one in the Cobble Hill neighborhood. title: POSTINGS: What Price Parking?; A 2d Garage Condo
